paragraphs.name: 504b
paragraphs.text: I’m still shocked that depressed people get told “but you don’t look depressed” because honestly how goddamn dare you. Who are you to say whether somebody looks depressed or not? Please acquaint yourself with the life-changing magic of shutting the fuck up. The only person who’s qualified to tell me whether I look depressed or not, is the guy who puts out the rotisserie chicken at my local Safeway.

paragraphs.name: 504b
paragraphs.text: I’m still shocked that depressed people get told “but you don’t look depressed” because honestly how goddamn dare you. Who are you to say whether somebody looks depressed or not? Please acquaint yourself with the life-changing magic of shutting the fuck up. The only person who’s qualified to tell me whether I look depressed or not, is the guy who puts out the rotisserie chicken at my local Safeway.

paragraphs.name: 6bf2
paragraphs.text: People often think depression looks a certain way — crying, sad, or, just finished crying. But it’s oh so much more than that! depression is chock-full of devastating layers. It runs deep and steady. I have an undercurrent of depression running through me at all times. Sometimes it’s more pronounced, other times it’s more Crouching Depression, Hidden Depression. But it’s always there.

Extremely Happy
An absolute staple. I have been donning Extremely Happy for years and, even though it’s torturous to wear, it will make you feel like part of society even though you’re dying inside! And isn’t that what’s truly important? Societal acceptance! Extremely Happy — It’s the LBD (little black depression) for your face.
paragraphs.name: 5aa7
6bf2
paragraphs.text: People often think depression looks a certain way — crying, sad, or, just finished crying. But it’s oh so much more than that! depression is chock-full of devastating layers. It runs deep and steady. I have an undercurrent of depression running through me at all times. Sometimes it’s more pronounced, other times it’s more Crouching Depression, Hidden Depression. But it’s always there.

Thanks for writing this post! I have struggled a lot to understand what going through depression feels like and how to respond to someone going through it. The ending note says it all “if in doubt, keep your mouth shut”
paragraphs.name: 6dfe

paragraphs.text: I guess it’s same thing as if someone’s going through high fever we better not ask them how does fever feel like!

depression — the gift that keeps taking. and taking. and taking.
oh yeah, did i remember to laugh when i wrote that?

fb49e9e6b384.title: I’ve also read about the positive effect of smiling on mood that @RandyMudge mentions.

paragraphs.text: I’ve also read about the positive effect of smiling on mood that @RandyMudge mentions. I’m reading a book Thinking, Fast and Slow and it’s fascinating, and surprising, to learn how our facial expressions can affect our thinking. While I don’t think for one minute that smiling can cure depression, I think it can help lift us. In those moments, we can…

paragraphs.text: so much this. and it is so hard to explain to anyone who has not suffered from depression. when you are in remission, it doesn’t mean that it is just gone, it’s always there, sometimes quiet, sometimes very very loud.

caab27c2072a.title: This is so beautiful and accurate , it is extremely hard to explain to the normals how depression…

paragraphs.text: This is so beautiful and accurate , it is extremely hard to explain to the normals how depression feels. They do not understand that there is something between sad and happy , a void where you’re perpetually stuck. Thank you for this
